name: Neer Dosa
history: Neer Dosa, a delicacy from Karnataka, India, literally translates to 'water dosa'. It's known for its simple ingredients and quick cooking time, making it a popular breakfast dish.
description: Neer Dosa is a thin, lacy, and delicate crepe made from a batter of soaked rice, ground finely and mixed with water. This dosa doesn't require fermentation and is served with chutney or curry.

equipment.name: blender or grinder
equipment.description: Used for grinding the rice to a fine batter.

equipment.name: ladle
equipment.description: Used for pouring the batter onto the skillet.

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: Soak the rice in water for 2-3 hours. Drain and grind the rice with enough water to make a thin batter. The consistency should be watery. Add salt to taste.

instructions.title: Cook the Dosas
instructions.description: Heat a non-stick skillet or tawa. Grease it lightly with oil. Pour a ladleful of batter and swirl the pan to spread it thinly. Cover and cook until the edges start to lift off. Neer dosa should be white and not browned.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Neer Dosa hot with coconut chutney, sambar, or any side dish of your choice.

tips: The batter should be of a runny consistency for lace-like dosas.
Do not flip the dosa; it's cooked only on one side.
variations: Add grated coconut or cooked rice to the batter for different textures.
Experiment with different types of rice for subtle flavor differences.

storage.shelfLife: The batter can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat dosas on a skillet until warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a banana leaf with a variety of chutneys for an authentic experience.
